Alex Ruthmann Joins Music Education Faculty    Music Education Hackday    NYU Singers visit Abu Dhabi    Music Ed Alum Núñez Earns 2011 MacArthur Award    Check out Photos from NYU's Madrigal singers at Saks Fifth Avenue    View New Choral Arts Society Video    Announcing New BMus / MA Music Ed Dual Degree    NYU receives MENC Collegiate Membership Chapter Growth Recognition Award       Selected Events       Summer Music Education / Kodály workshop       Featured Students       Read about our current students    Current Master's student, Peter Douskalis, receives great reviews for debut CD from All About Jazz and Just Jazz Guitar           Teacher Education AT NYU STEINHARDT        Our NYU Music Education Program is dedicated to developing artistic, reflective, and creative music educators for careers in schools, the community and private settings.    Our B.M., M.A., and Ph.D. music education majors perform and study with New York's finest classical, jazz, music theater, world music performers, and artist-teachers.    Through our programs you have access to:       an internationally renowned faculty of music education scholars    Greenwich Village and New York City, the cultural capital of the world    supervised teaching placements and internships in New York's finest public, private, and community music schools    diverse learners in multicultural environments    unparalleled music technology facilities    NYU's study abroad programs in Prague, Florence, and 25 other cities on four continents    arts education consortiums including music, art, dance and theater       All of these opportunities take full advantage of a warm and collegial Department of Music and Performing Arts Professions that offers an exceptional range of program electives including Performance, Music Technology, Composition, Educational Theatre, Dance Education, Music Therapy, Music Theatre and Classical Voice, Jazz Studies, and more.    The NYU Steinhardt Teacher Education Program is fully accredited by the Teacher Education Accreditation Council.    B.M., M.A., Advanced Certificate, Ph.D.    To speak to us personally, or to arrange a visit, please contact our advisors:    Undergraduate Music Education: Prof. Ira Shankman Graduate Music Education (M.A.), contact: Prof. Nancy Shankman Graduate Music Education (M.A.) and Advanced Certificate, contact: Dr. John Gilbert Ph.D., contact: Dr. David J. Music and Performing Arts                  How to Apply    Requirements        Overview     Candidacy     Topic     Proposal          Curriculum    Dates        Candidacy     Proposal          Guidelines                    Welcome to Doctoral Studies - Music and Performing Arts                        The Department of Music and Performing Arts Professions offers four doctoral programs in the following areas:       Music Performance and Composition    Music Education    Educational Theatre    Music Technology       These pages provide information and links relevant to the application process, the curriculum and requirements of our programs, important deadlines for our doctoral students, as well as the policies and guidelines that govern doctoral studies in our department.    The director of Doctoral Studies for the department is Dr. Philip Taylor. He coordinates various stages and committees involved in doctoral study, addresses questions and concerns from students and faculty, and works closely with the directors of each program in setting and enforcing doctoral policies.                 Department of Music and Performing Arts Professions - 35 W. 4th Street, Suite 1077 -  New York, NY 10012 -  212 998 5424    This site, and all its contents, are Copyright ©    by New York University.
